seg.seg: Pāramitās [“perfect virtues”], however, the Buddha, the master, has practised over three Asaṃkhyeyas and a hundred kalpas [“world eras”]. The Asaṃkhyeya-period, however, is very
long. For when the mahākalpas arrive at the sixtieth gaṇisthāna, at that moment it is [only] one asaṃkhyeya.
Because when the mahākalpas arrive at the sixtieth gaṇisthāna, at that moment it is [only] one asaṃkhyeya. (cf 22)
One should understand [the word] of Gaṇitasthāna [as] “a place of numbers”. If eighty antarakalpas pass, it is one mahākalpa. ...
If eighty antarakalpas pass, it is one mahākalpa. (cf 22)
If there is one mahākalpa, it is in the first gaṇitasthāna; if there are two, three, until nine mahākalpas,

If there is one mahākalpa, it is in the first gaṇitasthāna; if there are two, three, until nine mahākalpas, they are just in the first [gaṇitasthāna]; if there are ten mahākalpas, they are in the second gaṇitasthāna; if there are twenty, thirty, until ninety, they are just in the second; if there are a hundred mahākalpas, they are in the third gaṇitasthāna. (cf 22)

Ist es e i n Mahākalpa, [so] befindet er sich im ersten Gaṇitasthāna [Zahlenstelle]; sind es zwei, drei bis neun Ma(hākalpas), [so] befinden sie sich ebenfalls noch im ersten [Gaṇitasthāna]. Sind es zehn Mahākalpas, [so] (befinden sie sich) im zweiten Gaṇitasthāna. Sind es (zwanzig, dreiß)ig bis neunzig, [so] befinden sie sich ebenfalls noch im zweiten. Sind es hundert Mahākalpas, [so] befinden sie sich im (dritten Gaṇitasthā)na.

If it is o n e mahākalpa, it is in the first gaṇitasthāna; if its two, three, up to nine ma(hākalpas), they are also still in the first [gaṇitasthāna]. If there are ten mahākalpas, (they are) in the second gaṇitasthāna. If there are (twenty, thir)ty, up to ninety, they are also still in the second. If there are a hundred mahākalpas, they are in the (third gaṇitasthā)na.

If a being turns back from the Buddha rank from the third gaṇitasthāna, it is called “khaḍgaviṣāṇakalpa” and it goes into nirvāṇa as a pratyekabuddha. If, however, with firm determination and compassionate, it does not turn back from the third sthāna, from then on the Buddhas manifestly and definitely make the prophecy of the Buddha rank. (cf 22)

Der Arhat, der Buddha und Meister, hatte aber, als er der König namens Mahāprabhāsa war, mit [seinem] wie Diamant festen Entschluss den Samen zur umkehrlosen Buddhaschaft in seine Geburtenfolge gesät.

The arhat, the Buddha and master, however, when he was the king named Mahāprabhāsa, with determination as hard as diamond, had sown the seed of irreversible Buddha-hood into the sequence of his incarnations.
the king named Mahāprabhāsa, had with his determination as hard as diamond sown the seed of Buddhahood without turning back in his sequence of incarnations.
From there on, collecting the sambhāras of merit, he went into the third Gaṇitasthāna. From there also, he did not (turn back).
